intro: Tolmachevia krivochizhinii, commonly known as the pink spurge, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its striking pink to purple flowers that bloom in dense, spherical clusters. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to thrive in hot, dry environments. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. Tolmachevia krivochizhinii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
